intro: Ribes sublobatum, commonly known as the smooth currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which is part of the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are smooth on both sides, giving it its common name. Its small, aggregate fruits are typically red or yellow and appear in late summer. Ribes sublobatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
